body_html:
I also have the same issue. Curiously, it can be reproduced by running

import nltk
import torch

as a script (full output here: https://gist.github.com/fadel/9c1de0903f8ac2168cfb045315a6f151). Swapping those lines and importing torch first seems to avoid it.

Software:

  • Arch Linux (kernel 4.12.4)
  • Python 3.6
  • PyTorch 0.2.0.post1 (installed using pip and .whl from website link)
  • NLTK 3.2.4 (installed using pip).

NLTK 3.2.4 (installed using pip).
body:
I also have the same issue. Curiously, it can be reproduced by running
```python
import nltk
import torch
```
as a script (full output here: https://gist.github.com/fadel/9c1de0903f8ac2168cfb045315a6f151). Swapping those lines and importing torch first seems to avoid it.

Software:
* Arch Linux (kernel 4.12.4)
* Python 3.6
* PyTorch 0.2.0.post1 (installed using pip and .whl from website link)
* NLTK 3.2.4 (installed using pip).
